page.title: 19Ecology - Birds
page.content: The open arable farm land with pasture, small pockets of birch scrub,hawthorn, blackthorn scrub along the lanes and chiefly willow scrub along the rivers, dykes and drains, provide a variety of habitats for the different species.In addition to the common species of birds in these habitats there are few notable exceptions.The hawthorn and blackthorn hedges are teaming with{finches}and {buntings. Magpies}have increased to saturation. In summer the lanes buzz to the rattle of the{whitethroat, {lesser whitethroat}and{sedge warbler. {Yellow wagtails}predominate on pastures.Pride of place must go to the {hen harrier}seen regularly quartering its grounds in the winter in Misterton carrs. Waders including{godwits}also visit the carrs and{kingfisher}are sometimes seen in the wider drains.
